Data Sources

This page provides a brief overview of the datasets utilized, each contributing valuable insights to various aspects of our analysis. It includes the data sources I tapped into for information gathering, and you also have the option to download the datasets.

Consumption Data

1) Yearly Data

  • This dataset provides information on natural gas yearly consumption in the United States.
  • Data for natural gas consumption covers the years 2005 to 2022, presented in trillion cubic feet.
US Natural Gas Yearly Consumption Dataset
Year Consumption
2005 22.01
2006 21.70
2007 23.10
2008 23.28
2009 22.91
2010 24.09

Download yearly consumption data

2) Monthly Data

  • This dataset provides information on natural gas monthly consumption in the United States.
  • Data for natural gas consumption covers the years 2005 to 2022, presented in million cubic feet.
US Natural Gas Monthly Consumption Dataset
Month Consumption
1/1/05 2561858
2/1/05 2242986
3/1/05 2205787
4/1/05 1724877
5/1/05 1522613
6/1/05 1534122

Download monthly consumption data

3) Consumption By Sector Data

  • This dataset provides information on natural gas yearly consumption by sector in the United States.
  • Data for natural gas consumption covers the years 2005 to 2022, presented in billion cubic feet.
US Natural Gas Consumption by Sector Dataset
Year consumption sector
2005 5869 Electric power
2006 6222 Electric power
2007 6841 Electric power
2008 6668 Electric power
2009 6873 Electric power
2010 7387 Electric power

Download consumption by sector data

Production Data

1) Yearly Production

  • This dataset provides information on natural gas yearly production in the United States.
  • Data for natural gas production spans from 2005 to 2022, presented in billion cubic feet.
US Natural Gas Yearly Production Dataset
Year Production
2005 489.4
2006 501.7
2007 521.9
2008 546.1
2009 557.6
2010 575.2

Download yearly production data

2) Monthly Production

  • This dataset provides information on natural gas monthly production in the United States.
  • Data for natural gas production covers the years 2005 to 2022, presented in million cubic feet.
US Natural Gas Monthly Production Dataset
Month Production
1/1/05 2035036
2/1/05 1870546
3/1/05 2080504
4/1/05 1979474
5/1/05 2010625
6/1/05 1972975

Download monthly production data

Imports Data

1) Yearly Volume

  • This dataset provides information on the imports of natural gas worldwide, categorized by country.
  • The data covers the years 1997 to 2022.
  • The unit of analysis is million standard cubic meters (M standard cu m).
US Natural Gas Yearly Imports Dataset
Year Imports
1997 86090
1998 90150
1999 101710
2000 108970
2001 113320
2002 113650

Download Imports data

2) Monthly Volume

  • This dataset provides information on natural gas monthly imports in the United States.
  • Data for natural gas imports covers the years 1997 to 2022, presented in million cubic feet.
US Natural Gas Monthly Imports Dataset
Month Imports
1997-01-01 278288
1997-02-01 240545
1997-03-01 256985
1997-04-01 238178
1997-05-01 241732
1997-06-01 232118

Download monthly imports data

3) Yearly Prices

  • This dataset provides information on natural gas average annual imports price in the United States.
  • Data for natural gas imports covers the years 1997 to 2022, presented in dollars per thousand cubic feet.
US Natural Gas Yearly Average Imports Price Dataset
Year Imports_price
21 2017 2.60
22 2018 2.69
23 2019 2.55
24 2020 2.07
25 2021 3.78
26 2022 6.33

Download yearly imports price data

Exports Data

1) Yearly Volume

  • This dataset provides information on the exports of natural gas worldwide, categorized by country.
  • The data covers the years 1997 to 2022.
  • The unit of analysis is million standard cubic meters (M standard cu m).
US Natural Gas Yearly Exports Dataset
Year Exports
1997 4430
1998 4480
1999 4560
2000 6820
2001 10590
2002 14540

Download Imports data

2) Monthly Volume

  • This dataset provides information on natural gas monthly exports in the United States.
  • Data for natural gas exports covers the years 1997 to 2022, presented in million cubic feet.
US Natural Gas Monthly Exports Dataset
Month Exports
1997-01-01 12028
1997-02-01 12443
1997-03-01 16276
1997-04-01 13872
1997-05-01 10097
1997-06-01 9527

Download monthly exports data

3) Yearly Prices

  • This dataset provides information on natural gas average annual exports price in the United States.
  • Data for natural gas production covers the years 1997 to 2022, presented in dollars per thousand cubic feet.
US Natural Gas Yearly Average Exports Price Dataset
Year Exports_price
21 2017 3.54
22 2018 3.89
23 2019 3.64
24 2020 3.70
25 2021 6.38
26 2022 9.64

Download yearly imports price data

CO2 Emissions Data

  • This dataset contains carbon dioxide emissions from energy consumption of natural gas in the USA.
  • The data spans from the year 2000 to 2023.
  • The unit of measurement is millions of metric tons of carbon dioxide.
US Natural Gas Monthly CO2 Emissions Dataset
Date co2_value
305 6/1/23 127.178
306 7/1/23 143.918
307 8/1/23 144.409
308 9/1/23 127.841
309 10/1/23 131.738
310 11/1/23 152.661

Download Natural gas CO2 Emissions Data

GHG Emissions Data

  • Contains an extensive selection of Greenhouse gas emissions data from the energy sector for over 190 countries and regions.
  • The data included in this file with the following indicators:
    • Energy related greenhouse gas emissions
    • Fugitive greenhouse gas emissions
    • Extended time series, starting in 1751 of CO2 emissions from fuel combustion.
US Natural Gas Yearly GHG Emissions Dataset
Year Total.GHG..emissions.from.fuel.combustion natural.gas other
1971 4338.88 1197.8 3141.08
1972 4580.87 1210.1 3370.77
1973 4746.14 1200.1 3546.04
1974 4594.17 1158.6 3435.57
1975 4409.86 1063.4 3346.46
1976 4674.07 1084.7 3589.37

Download GHG emissions data

Prices Data

1) Henry Hub Prices

  • This dataset contains the monthly average henry hub natural gas spot price in the USA.
  • The data spans from the year 1973 to 2023.
  • Prices are measured in Dollars per Million Btu.
US Average Henry Hub Natural Gas Spot Price Dataset
Month Henry.Hub.Natural.Gas.Spot.Price.Dollars.per.Million.Btu
1/1/05 6.15
2/1/05 6.14
3/1/05 6.96
4/1/05 7.16
5/1/05 6.47
6/1/05 7.18

Download Henry Hub Natural Gas Spot Price Data

2) Prices By Sector

  • This dataset contains the yearly average price of natural gas delivered to residential and commercial consumers in the USA.
  • The data spans from the year 1997 to 2023.
  • Prices are measured in dollars per thousand cubic feet.
US Average Natural Gas Price By Sector Dataset
Year prices sector
1997 6.94 Residential
1998 6.82 Residential
1999 6.69 Residential
2000 7.76 Residential
2001 9.63 Residential
2002 7.89 Residential

Download Natural Gas Prices By Sector Data

Industry Employment Data

1) By Gender

  • Contains information of the workforce in the U.S. natural gas distribution industry by gender and age from 2014 to 2021
Workforce in US Natural Gas Distribution Industry By Gender And Age Dataset
Year Gender Total.Population Age.Group
2021 Female 81 16 to 19
2021 Female 1278 20 to 24
2021 Female 2619 25 to 29
2021 Female 3399 30 to 34
2021 Female 2729 35 to 39
2021 Female 2214 40 to 44

Download employment by gender and age data

2) By Location

  • Contains information of the workforce in the U.S. natural gas distribution industry by location from 2014 to 2021
Workforce in US Natural Gas Distribution Industry By Location Dataset
State Year Total.Population Code
Alabama 2021 2371 AL
Alabama 2020 2685 AL
Alabama 2019 2111 AL
Alabama 2018 2210 AL
Alabama 2017 2532 AL
Alabama 2016 2157 AL

Download employment by location data

3) By Wage

  • Contains information of the the U.S. natural gas distribution industry yearly wage from 2014 to 2021
US Natural Gas Distribution Industry Yearly Wage Dataset
ID.Year Average.Wage
2021 86281.42
2020 81508.72
2019 79726.42
2018 77958.03
2017 75065.32
2016 72986.09

Download employment by wage data

GDP Data

1) US GDP

  • This dataset presents Quarterly Gross domestic product (GDP) figures for the United States.
  • The data spans from the year 2005 to 2022.
  • The unit of analysis is Billions of Dollars, Seasonally Adjusted Annual Rate.
US GDP Dataset
Quarter GDP
2005-01-01 12767.29
2005-04-01 12922.66
2005-07-01 13142.64
2005-10-01 13324.20
2006-01-01 13599.16
2006-04-01 13753.42

Download US GDP data

2) Netherlands GDP

  • This dataset presents Quarterly Gross domestic product (GDP) figures for Netherlands.
  • The data spans from the year 2005 to 2022.
  • The unit of analysis is Millions of Euros,Seasonally Adjusted.
Netherlands GDP Dataset
Date gdp_int
1/1/05 134841.1
4/1/05 136587.9
7/1/05 138671.4
10/1/05 140509.7
1/1/06 143090.4
4/1/06 145172.7

Download Netherlands GDP data

Stocks Data

  • This data represents daily opening price, highest price, lowest price, closing price, adjusted closing price, and trading volume for Chevron Corp (NYSE:CVX) on different dates from 2000 to 2022.
  • It will be used in financial analysis to track the performance and volatility of the stock prices for top natural gas producing companies over time.
CVX Stocks Dataset
CVX.Adjusted CVX.Open CVX.Close CVX.High CVX.Low CVX.Volume Date
17.13982 42.93750 41.81250 42.93750 41.28125 4387600 2000-01-03
17.13982 41.46875 41.81250 42.06250 41.25000 3702400 2000-01-04
17.44725 41.53125 42.56250 43.28125 41.53125 5567600 2000-01-05
18.19024 42.65625 44.37500 44.59375 42.65625 4353400 2000-01-06
18.51048 45.00000 45.15625 45.43750 44.50000 4487400 2000-01-07
18.01089 45.03125 43.93750 45.03125 43.84375 2104800 2000-01-10

Download Chevron Corporation (CVX) stocks data

Exchange Rates Data

  • This dataset presents quaterly average exchange rate for converting US Dollars to Netherlands national currency (USD to EUR) figures.
  • The data spans from the year 2005 to 2022.
  • The unit of analysis is Euro, Not Seasonally Adjusted.
Exchange Rate for Netherlands Dataset
Date exchange_rate
2005-01-01 105.2033
2005-04-01 103.9500
2005-07-01 102.4767
2005-10-01 101.5567
2006-01-01 100.7100
2006-04-01 102.1833

Download Exchange Rate data

Storage Data

  • This dataset contains the monthly underground storage volume of natural gas in the USA.
  • The data spans from the year 2005 to 2022
  • The unit of analysis is Million Cubic Feet.
Natural Gas Storage in the US Dataset
Month U.S..Natural.Gas.Underground.Storage.Volume..Million.Cubic.Feet
1/1/05 6199291
2/1/05 5768939
3/1/05 5484332
4/1/05 5699060
5/1/05 6075521
6/1/05 6398738

Download Storage Data

Temperature Data

  • This dataset contains the monthly average temperature figures across the USA.
  • The data spans from the year 2005 to 2022.
  • The temperature is measured in fahrenheit.
Average Temperature in the US Dataset
moonth avg_temp
1/1/05 33.4

## Consumption Data

**1) Yearly Data**

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/statista.png){width="40%"}](https://www.statista.com/topics/1220/natural-gas-energy/#statisticChapter)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset provides information on natural gas yearly consumption in the United States.
-   Data for natural gas consumption covers the years 2005 to 2022, presented in trillion cubic feet.
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
yearly_consump_df<-read.csv("datasets/Book5.csv")
knitr::kable(head(yearly_consump_df[1:2]), caption = "US Natural Gas Yearly Consumption Dataset")
```
[Download yearly consumption data](datasets/consumption_us.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
library(quantmod)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
library(tidyverse)
# Plotting the data
year_consumption <- ggplot(yearly_consump_df, 
                                       aes(x = Year, y = Consumption)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  geom_point(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "US Natural Gas Yearly Consumption",
       x = "Year",
       y = "Consumption (trillion cubic feet)") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(year_consumption)

```

**2) Monthly Data **

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/eia.png){width="40%"}](https://www.eia.gov/dnav/ng/hist/n9140us2m.htm)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset provides information on natural gas monthly consumption in the United States.
-   Data for natural gas consumption covers the years 2005 to 2022, presented in million cubic feet.
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
monthly_consump_df<-read.csv("datasets/eda/Consumption.csv")
knitr::kable(head(monthly_consump_df), caption = "US Natural Gas Monthly Consumption Dataset")
```
[Download monthly consumption data](datasets/Consumption.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
# Plotting the data
# Convert "Month" column to Date type
monthly_consump_df$Date <- as.Date(monthly_consump_df$Month, format = "%m/%d/%Y")

# Replace the first '0' in the year part of the date with '2'
monthly_consump_df$Date <- gsub("^0", "2", monthly_consump_df$Date)
monthly_consump_df$Date <- as.Date(monthly_consump_df$Date, format = "%Y-%m-%d")

month_consumption <- ggplot(monthly_consump_df, 
                                       aes(x = Date, y = Consumption)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "US Natural Gas Monthly Consumption",
       x = "Month",
       y = "Consumption (million cubic feet)") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(month_consumption)
```

**3) Consumption By Sector Data **

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/statista.png){width="40%"}](https://www.statista.com/topics/1220/natural-gas-energy/#statisticChapter)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset provides information on natural gas yearly consumption by sector in the United States.
-   Data for natural gas consumption covers the years 2005 to 2022, presented in billion cubic feet.
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
sector_consump_df<-read.csv("datasets/Book6.csv")
knitr::kable(head(sector_consump_df[1:3]), caption = "US Natural Gas Consumption by Sector Dataset")
```
 [Download consumption by sector data](datasets/consumption_us_bysector.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false

# Stacked barplot with multiple groups
ggplot(data=sector_consump_df, aes(x=Year, y=consumption, fill=sector)) +
  geom_bar(stat="identity")+
  labs(title = "US Natural Gas Consumption By Sector",
       x = "Year",
       y = "Consumption (billion cubic feet)") +
theme_minimal()
```

## Production Data

**1) Yearly Production **


::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/statista.png){width="40%"}](https://www.statista.com/topics/1220/natural-gas-energy/#statisticChapter)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset provides information on natural gas yearly production in the United States.
-   Data for natural gas production spans from 2005 to 2022, presented in billion cubic feet.
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
yearly_prod_df<-read.csv("datasets/Book5.csv")
knitr::kable(head(yearly_prod_df[, c(1, 3)]), caption = "US Natural Gas Yearly Production Dataset")
```
[Download yearly production data](datasets/production_us.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
# Plotting the data
year_production <- ggplot(yearly_prod_df, 
                                       aes(x = Year, y = Production)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  geom_point(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "US Natural Gas Yearly Production",
       x = "Year",
       y = "Production (billion cubic feet)") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(year_production)
```

**2) Monthly Production **

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/eia.png){width="40%"}](https://www.eia.gov/dnav/ng/hist/n9010us2m.htm)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset provides information on natural gas monthly production in the United States.
-   Data for natural gas production covers the years 2005 to 2022, presented in million cubic feet.
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
monthly_prod_df<-read.csv("datasets/eda/Production.csv")
knitr::kable(head(monthly_prod_df), caption = "US Natural Gas Monthly Production Dataset")
```
[Download monthly production data](datasets/Production.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
# Plotting the data
# Convert "Month" column to Date type
monthly_prod_df$Date <- as.Date(monthly_prod_df$Month, format = "%m/%d/%Y")

# Replace the first '0' in the year part of the date with '2'
monthly_prod_df$Date <- gsub("^0", "2", monthly_prod_df$Date)
monthly_prod_df$Date <- as.Date(monthly_prod_df$Date, format = "%Y-%m-%d")

month_production <- ggplot(monthly_prod_df, 
                                       aes(x = Date, y = Production)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "US Natural Gas Monthly Production",
       x = "Month",
       y = "Production (million cubic feet)") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(month_production)
```


## Imports Data

**1) Yearly Volume**

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/opec.png){width="40%"}](https://asb.opec.org/data/ASB_Data.php)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset provides information on the imports of natural gas worldwide, categorized by country.
-   The data covers the years 1997 to 2022.
-   The unit of analysis is million standard cubic meters (M standard cu m).
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
yearly_imp_df<-read.csv("datasets/book7.csv")
knitr::kable(head(yearly_imp_df[1:2]), caption = "US Natural Gas Yearly Imports Dataset")
```
[Download Imports data](datasets/importss.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false

# Plotting the data
year_imports <- ggplot(yearly_imp_df, 
                                       aes(x = Year, y = Imports)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  geom_point(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "US Natural Gas Yearly Imports",
       x = "Year",
       y = "Imports (M standard cu m)") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(year_imports)

```



**2) Monthly Volume**

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/eia.png){width="40%"}](https://www.eia.gov/dnav/ng/hist/n9130us3M.htm)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset provides information on natural gas monthly imports in the United States.
-   Data for natural gas imports covers the years 1997 to 2022, presented in million cubic feet.
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
monthly_imp_df<-read.csv("datasets/eda/imports.csv")
knitr::kable(head(monthly_imp_df), caption = "US Natural Gas Monthly Imports Dataset")
```
[Download monthly imports data](datasets/Imports_monthly.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
# Plotting the data
# Convert "Month" column to Date type
monthly_imp_df$Date <- as.Date(monthly_imp_df$Month, format = "%Y-%m-%d")

month_imp <- ggplot(monthly_imp_df, 
                                       aes(x = Date, y = Imports)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "US Natural Gas Monthly Imports",
       x = "Month",
       y = "Imports (million cubic feet)") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(month_imp)
```


**3) Yearly Prices**

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/eia.png){width="40%"}](https://www.eia.gov/dnav/ng/hist/n9100us3A.htm)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset provides information on natural gas average annual imports price in the United States.
-   Data for natural gas imports covers the years 1997 to 2022, presented in dollars per thousand cubic feet.
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
price_imp_df<-read.csv("datasets/book7.csv")
knitr::kable(tail(price_imp_df[, c(1, 4)]), caption = "US Natural Gas Yearly Average Imports Price Dataset")
```

[Download yearly imports price data](datasets/imports_price.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false

# Plotting the data
year_imports_price <- ggplot(price_imp_df, 
                                       aes(x = Year, y = Imports_price)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  geom_point(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "US Natural Gas Yearly Average Imports Price",
       x = "Year",
       y = "Imports Price (dollars per thousand cubic feet)") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(year_imports_price)

```



## Exports Data

**1) Yearly Volume**

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/opec.png){width="40%"}](https://asb.opec.org/data/ASB_Data.php)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset provides information on the exports of natural gas worldwide, categorized by country.
-   The data covers the years 1997 to 2022.
-   The unit of analysis is million standard cubic meters (M standard cu m).
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
yearly_exp_df<-read.csv("datasets/book7.csv")

```

                                       aes(x = Year, y = Exports)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  geom_point(color = '#92c54b') +

       x = "Year",

## CO2 Emissions Data


::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/eia.png){width="40%"}](https://www.eia.gov/environment/emissions/carbon/)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset contains carbon dioxide emissions from energy consumption of natural gas in the USA.
-   The data spans from the year 2000 to 2023.
-   The unit of measurement is millions of metric tons of carbon dioxide.

:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
co2_emissions_df<-read.csv("datasets/eda/co2_emissions.csv")
knitr::kable(tail(co2_emissions_df[, c(1, 3)]), caption = "US Natural Gas Monthly CO2 Emissions Dataset")
```

[Download Natural gas CO2 Emissions Data](datasets/co2_emissions.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
# Convert "Month" column to Date type
co2_emissions_df$Date <- as.Date(co2_emissions_df$Date, format = "%m/%d/%Y")
# Replace the first '0' in the year part of the date with '2'
co2_emissions_df$Date <- gsub("^0", "2", co2_emissions_df$Date)
co2_emissions_df$Date <- as.Date(co2_emissions_df$Date, format = "%Y-%m-%d")

# Plotting the data
co2_emmissions<- ggplot(co2_emissions_df, 
                                       aes(x = Date, y = co2_value)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "US Natural Gas Monthly CO2 Emissions",
       x = "Month",
       y = "Volume (millions of metric tons of co2)") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(co2_emmissions)

```

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   Contains an extensive selection of Greenhouse gas emissions data from the energy sector for over 190 countries and regions.
-   The data included in this file with the following indicators:
    -   Energy related greenhouse gas emissions
    -   Fugitive greenhouse gas emissions
    -   Extended time series, starting in 1751 of CO2 emissions from fuel combustion.

## Prices Data

**1) Henry Hub Prices**

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/eia.png){width="40%"}](https://www.eia.gov/dnav/ng/hist/rngwhhdM.htm)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
- This dataset contains the monthly average henry hub natural gas spot price in the USA.
- The data spans from the year 1973 to 2023.
- Prices are measured in Dollars per Million Btu.
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
hhp_df<-read.csv("datasets/eda/Henry_Hub_Natural_Gas_Spot_Price.csv")
knitr::kable(head(hhp_df), caption = "US Average Henry Hub Natural Gas Spot Price Dataset")
```

[Download Henry Hub Natural Gas Spot Price Data](datasets/Henry_Hub_Natural_Gas_Spot_Price.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
# Convert "Month" column to Date type
hhp_df$Date <- as.Date(hhp_df$Month, format = "%m/%d/%Y")

# Replace the first '0' in the year part of the date with '2'
hhp_df$Date <- gsub("^0", "2", hhp_df$Date)
hhp_df$Date <- as.Date(hhp_df$Date, format = "%Y-%m-%d")

# Plotting the data
hhp <- ggplot(hhp_df, aes(x = Date, y = Henry.Hub.Natural.Gas.Spot.Price.Dollars.per.Million.Btu)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "US Average Henry Hub Natural Gas Spot Prices",
       x = "Year",
       y = "Henry Hub Spot Prices (Dollars per Million Btu)") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(hhp)
```

  geom_bar(position="dodge", stat="identity")+

       x = "Year",

  geom_bar(position="dodge", stat="identity", fill='#92c54b')+
  labs(title = "US Natural Gas Distribution Industry Employment By Age Group",
       x = "Age Group",
       y = "Total Workforce",
      ) +

p+ theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45))

## GDP Data

**1) US GDP**

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/fred.png){width="40%"}](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/GDP)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset presents Quarterly Gross domestic product (GDP) figures for the United States.
-   The data spans from the year 2005 to 2022.
-   The unit of analysis is Billions of Dollars, Seasonally Adjusted Annual Rate.

:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false

knitr::kable(head(gdp_df), caption = "US GDP Dataset")
```
[Download US GDP data](datasets/gdp.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
# Convert "Month" column to Date type
gdp_df$Date <- as.Date(gdp_df$Quarter, format = "%Y-%m-%d")

# Plotting the data
gdp <- ggplot(gdp_df, 
                                       aes(x = Date, y = GDP)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  geom_point(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "US GDP",
       x = "Quarter",
       y = "GDP (Billions of Dollars)") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(gdp)

```

## Unemployment Data

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/usbureaulaborstat.png){width="40%"}](https://www.bls.gov/cps/)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This dataset presents monthly unemployment rate figures for the USA.
-   The data spans from the year 2005 to 2022.
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
unemp_df<-read.csv("datasets/eda/unemp.csv")
knitr::kable(head(unemp_df), caption = "US Monthly Unemployment Rate Dataset")
```


[Download Unemployment data](datasets/unemp.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false


##unpivot
unemp_df <- unemp_df %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = Jan:Dec,  #the range of columns to unpivot
    names_to = "Month",  
    values_to = "Unemp"  
  )

unemp_df$Date <- make_date(year = unemp_df$Year, month = match(unemp_df$Month, month.abb), day = 1)
# reorder columns to place Date first and drop Year and Month as they are no longer needed
unemp_df <- unemp_df[, c("Date", "Unemp")]
unemp_df$Date <- as.Date(unemp_df$Date, format = "%Y-%m-%d")

# Plotting the data
Unemp <- ggplot(unemp_df, 
                                       aes(x = Date, y = Unemp)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "Unemployment Rate in the US",
       x = "Month",
       y = "Unemployment Rate") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(Unemp)

```

## Stocks Data

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/yahoo_fin.png){width="40%"}](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/top-25-natural-gas-producers-204113643.html)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
-   This data represents daily opening price, highest price, lowest price, closing price, adjusted closing price, and trading volume for Chevron Corp (NYSE:CVX) on different dates from 2000 to 2022.
-   It will be used in financial analysis to track the performance and volatility of the stock prices for top natural gas producing companies over time.

:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
options("getSymbols.warning4.0"=FALSE)
options("getSymbols.yahoo.warning"=FALSE)

# Chevron Corp's Stock Price

tickers = c("CVX")
for (i in tickers){
  getSymbols(i,
             from = "2000-01-01",
             to = "2022-12-31")}
x <- list(
  title = "date"
)
y <- list(
  title = "value"
)

cvx <- data.frame(CVX$CVX.Adjusted, CVX$CVX.Open, CVX$CVX.Close, CVX$CVX.High, CVX$CVX.Low, CVX$CVX.Volume)

cvx$Date <- rownames(cvx)
rownames(cvx) <- NULL

cvx$Date<-as.Date(cvx$Date,"%Y-%m-%d")
knitr::kable(head(cvx), caption = "CVX Stocks Dataset")
```

[Download Chevron Corporation (CVX) stocks data](datasets/cvx_stocks.zip)

storage_df$Date <- as.Date(storage_df$Month, format = "%m/%d/%Y")

# Replace the first '0' in the year part of the date with '2'

storage_df$Date <- as.Date(storage_df$Date, format = "%Y-%m-%d")

                                       aes(x = Date, y = U.S..Natural.Gas.Underground.Storage.Volume..Million.Cubic.Feet)) +

## Temperature Data

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
[![click image for data source](img/datasrc/USA-Today-Logo.png){width="50%"}](https://data.usatoday.com/weather-data/national-contiguous-48-states/00/2022-12-01/)
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
- This dataset contains the monthly average temperature figures across the USA.
- The data spans from the year 2005 to 2022.
- The temperature is measured in fahrenheit.
:::
:::

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
temp_df<-read.csv("datasets/eda/temperature.csv")
knitr::kable(head(temp_df[1:2]), caption = "Average Temperature in the US Dataset")
```
[Download Temperature Data](temperature.zip)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
#| code-fold: true
#| warning: false
# Convert "Month" column to Date type
temp_df$Date <- as.Date(temp_df$moonth, format = "%m/%d/%Y")

# Replace the first '0' in the year part of the date with '2'
temp_df$Date <- gsub("^0", "2", temp_df$Date)
temp_df$Date <- as.Date(temp_df$Date, format = "%Y-%m-%d")

# Plotting the data
temp <- ggplot(temp_df, 
                                       aes(x = Date, y = avg_temp)) +
  geom_line(color = '#92c54b') +
  geom_point(color = '#92c54b') +
  labs(title = "Average Temperature in the US",
       x = "Month",
       y = "Temperature (Fahrenheit)") +
theme_minimal()
ggplotly(temp)

```
